means: 搞阴谋诡计(intrigue的现在分词)

sentence.Network_en: Some of the ideas are very intriguing and sound intuitively plausible.
sentence.Network_cn: 有些想法非常吸引人，听起来觉得很有道理。

sentence.Network_en: This is an ambitious and intriguing movie, full of striking imagery.

The most intriguing film I have ever seen is a film detective story ., 我看过的最有趣的电影是一部侦探片.

entry.tran: 有趣的;引人入胜的;奇怪的
entry.def: If you describe something as intriguing, you mean that it is interesting or strange.

example.ex: This intriguing book is both thoughtful and informative.
example.tran: 这本引人入胜的书既有思想性又富知识性。
